analysis.Summary: Activity.vue is a presentational Vue component (using <script setup>) that takes numeric props for likes, comments, and subscriptions, and renders a styled flex container showing each metric with an icon and label if the corresponding prop is provided.
analysis.Purpose: To serve as a reusable UI block in the community module, displaying key interaction metrics (likes, comments, subscriptions) in a consistent, styled layout.

Components.name: Activity
Components.role: Root component that handles layout and conditional rendering of individual metric blocks.

analysis.Usage:
Import the component into a parent view or layout:

import Activity from 'modules/community/components/blocks/Activity.vue';

Then use it in the template with bound props:

<Activity :likes="post.likes" :comments="post.comments" :subscriptions="user.subscriptions" />
Notes: Imports ref and computed but does not use themâ€”these imports can be removed.
Icons are hardcoded emojis; the subscription block reuses the thumbs-up emoji, which may be unintended.
All styling relies on utility CSS classes; no <style> block is present in the file.
